title: Campbell's Tater Tot Casserole Recipe
description: Campbell's tater tot casserole is an oven-baked cast iron skillet meal made with ground beef and condensed soup for an easy weeknight meal kids love.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Dinner Campbell's Tater Tot Casserole 4.4 (577) 454 Reviews 124 Photos Campbell's tater tot casserole is a kid-friendly ground beef skillet casserole that goes from the stovetop to the oven and straight to the table in 35 minutes. Submitted by Campbell's Kitchen Updated on August 23, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 124 124 124 124 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 5 Yield: 1 12x8-inch dish Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 5 servings 1 pound ground beef 1 medium onion, chopped 1 (10.5 ounce) can Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free) 1 tablespoon ketchup 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce 3 cups frozen Tater Tots Directions Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Heat a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease. Stir condensed soup, ketchup, and Worcestershire into the skillet. Spoon beef mixture into a 12x8-inch shallow baking dish. Arrange tater tots around the edge of casserole. Bake in the preheated oven until tater tots are cooked through, about 25 minutes. I Made It Print 1,700 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 356 Calories 21g Fat 27g Carbs 18g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 5 Calories 356 % Daily Value * Total Fat 21g 27% Saturated Fat 6g 32% Cholesterol 59mg 20% Sodium 849mg 37% Total Carbohydrate 27g 10% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 3g Protein 18g 36% Vitamin C 3mg 4% Calcium 16mg 1% Iron 2mg 10% Potassium 450mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Campbell's Tater Tot Casserole 01 of 124 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 124 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 03/13/2025 I broiled the top of tater tots to crisp them up. Turned out great! 03 of 124 Photo by  John OHara 03/06/2024 Interesting. I’m not really sure what to think about this. Little dry maybe because of the cast iron. gonna finish it but I don’t think I’ll make it again. 04 of 124 Photo by  Shay 09/11/2020 05 of 124 Photo by  Wendi Garland 09/08/2020 I used a mix of fries this time. Tator rounds and seasoned fries. Hubby loved it with the seasoned fries. And I was just trying to use up opened bags so I didn't have to open more bags. lol shhh 06 of 124 Photo by  Carlie Saunders 08/29/2020 07 of 124 Photo by  Jazmin Marie Brunson 08/18/2020 This is one of my husband’s favorite dishes!!! He’s vegetarian so we use the zesty Italian meatless meatballs and the Morningstar grillers crumbles; we add red, yellow, and green bell peppers to the onion mix. My mom used cream of mushroom but I like cream of potato better we mix it up with some soy milk, vegetable broth, mixed vegetables and whatever seasonings you like. We put half of the tot on the bottom of the pan and the other half on top cause why not. Sometimes we use different cheese blends to top it off but there’s almost always some jiffy cornbread on the side! 08 of 124 Photo by  Neesee 05/19/2020 This was delicious! I followed the recipe to a t except I shredded some sharp cheddar cheese and put it on top of the tater tots at the very end. So yummy 09 of 124 Photo by  Neesee 05/19/2020 This was delicious! I followed the recipe to a t except I shredded some sharp cheddar cheese and put it on top of the tater tots at the very end. So yummy 10 of 124 Photo by  Dawn MM 04/12/2020 Turned out great. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Tater Tots Casserole 365 Ratings Savory Tater Tot Casserole 340 Ratings French Fry Casserole 43 Ratings Green Bean Tater Tot Casserole 233 Ratings Fiesta Tater Tot Casserole 43 Ratings Tater Tot Taco Casserole with Queso 51 Ratings Hamburger Potato Casserole 1,568 Ratings Quick and Easy Tater Tot Casserole 213 Ratings Tater Tot Hot Dish II 238 Ratings Taco Taters 33 Ratings Campbell's Kitchen Broccoli and Cheese Casserole 47 Ratings Campbell's Kitchen Chicken Broccoli Divan 184 Ratings Sloppy Tots 18 Ratings 'Chinese' Pie 27 Ratings Zucchini Pizza Bake 138 Ratings Easy Tater Tot Casserole 120 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Campbell's Kitchen
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).;Heat a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.;Stir condensed soup, ketchup, and Worcestershire into the skillet. Spoon beef mixture into a 12x8-inch shallow baking dish. Arrange tater tots around the edge of casserole.;Bake in the preheated oven until tater tots are cooked through, about 25 minutes.
